x26lHzMJk1g.title: This Combo is just BROKEN in Oaken Tower
x26lHzMJk1g.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vApiI3Ez6A&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7AiSFN60y-_fm7JlW04peCe
Today we explore a broken Combo in Elve- I mean Oaken Tower: The Evlish Orb. The Elvish Orb gives +1 Multicast to an Elven item - permanently, not temporarly. For that it needs 12 seconds and that's the biggest issue, to either survive that long or to not kill the enemies prior to it triggering. And that's the real issue, even though it may sound nice to destroy the enemies, at one point you will get overpowered and die so fast that Elvish Orb also can't trigger, going into a cycle of repeated losses until the game is over. So the plan is simple: Get Lost Fragment below an optimally upgraded Elvish Orb so it will double trigger, giving +4 Multicast immediately, which is usually enough to win the game or at least to get very far.

Oaken Tower is a synergy-heavy PvP autobattler where your tower of items fights other players. Build deadly combos and scale exponentially. Every decision matters.

in_g76pWO4I.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7CMXM4UjhBUKfNkwfVLd4eD
Today we play Bounty of One and take on the highest difficulty possible - Infamy Level 50. It would be too much to put everything in here, but how about: Bouncing enemy projectiles, 5 times the damage and no healing is dropped? Yea, that sounds quite insane and is just a small part of the package. This time I am not allowed to make use of the "reroll banish exploit", or how I would call it: Using our brain. The "exploit" allows you to banish everything you roll through at once, so you are left with mostly legendary and mythical upgrades. Jokes aside, this does make the run a lot harder and/or a lot more serious, so there is left space to goof around and it shows in the final boss fight.

Today in Oaken Tower we have 2 amazing Multicast runs and one of them is very different from the norm, as it's one I've never seen before: The Elven Poison shield. With the Elven Orb we stack a ton of multicast on it, but one thing is missing: actual damage. So we take the Elven book to increase it's damage AND we multicast said book to multiply the damage faster and faster. In the second run we go for a more typical multicast with the Lunar Codex, slap a bunch of potions on it and since it now has bleed, we can combine it with Shardfang - a legendary dagger that attacks whenever we apply bleed (which we do a ton per attack), and helps us deal a lot more damage until Warhorn kicks in and explodes the damage of Lunar Codex.

Today in Oaken Tower we check out the Axes in the game, as I started to try out different things and found insane success with them. 9IPMrZwI4qk.title: I BROKE This New Brotato Tower Defense With MONEY in Book Shooter
9IPMrZwI4qk.description:
✵Game on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/3551370/Book_Shooter/
Today we check out Book Shooter, a game that pretty much combines Brotato and Tower Defense into one, a Horde Survivor where you stay stationary and slay the enemies - or a no movement challenge in Brotato. What starts out as a greedy take on the game where I want to maximize damage quickly turns out of control as I earn a ridiculous amount of money and buy everything without having to think about it. Eventually I realize that the equivalent to "Harvesting" in Brotato, Gathering, triggers every 10 seconds instead of at the end of the wave, the game is completely out of control. The cherry on the top is a combination of skills that allow us to scale up infinite amount of damage and more (honestly, so much I forgot what is all affected) and we don't even need to attack anymore to win. 

Book Shooter is a rougelike game that combines many different gameplays. There are a lot of magic, magic books, and enemies in the game. Come and fight!

WOItTcayUtY.description:

Today we go back to Godslayer Arena and start out innocently with a slight focus on making more use of the traits, whiiiich...yea, quickly turned into utter apocalypse. It all started with a ring that gives 4 experience per active trait, so even with just 5 traits active we'd get double the amount of XP we get per round, or the equivalent to skipping additional rolls. But why stop there? Get a legendary spell on top that casts like crazy, bonus mana, attack damage and spellpower per unique trait and nothing stays alive.

Godslayer Arena is a roguelike fusion of autobattlers and action-rpgs. Combat is performed completely automatically. Understanding complex interactions between the spells, gems, and items you draft will be key to success. Break the game. Become overpowered.

X_woTJ8Qs3c.title: I looted Monsters for LEGENDARY Equipment MAX | Overlooting
X_woTJ8Qs3c.description:
Today we check out Overlooting again as the last run is now 3 months ago and this time we stumble upon an absolutely broken trait: Wood, or what it's actually called: Villager. The first level of the trait gives you better items as if you progressed 10 more areas, but the second level at 5 pieces turns that into 20 areas. That means in area 7 we would actually get loot from area 27, or in other words: we almost only see the highest level equipment possible, leading to an absolutely broken build.

Adapt your strategy to a skill tree that changes every run, combine pieces of equipment to form powerful synergies and create a game-changing build capable of defeating the bosses that will try to stop you. In this Inventory Management Roguelike two games never feel the same!

HiuE5BS0Xu4.description:

Smash or pass? Definitely smash. Today we check out Berserk or Die, a game from Nao Games but published by our beloved Poncle, the team behind Vampire Survivors. In Berserk or Die one message is clear: Destroy your keyboard. The more you smash the harder you strike, using half of your keyboard to attack left and the other half to attack right. While it took some time to get used to it (and some workarounds using the mouse...) I started enjoying the game more and more and hope you also have a blast.

This is an action game in which players attempt to survive by defeating a number of enemies which appear from the left and right sides of the screen. Use a unique keyboard-banging control scheme for maximum dopamine! Go Berserk, or Die!

X_5EadOngi0.title: I beat Hardest Difficulty with 0 Items in Brotato Abyssal Terrors
X_5EadOngi0.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors I take on a challenge I was working on for a while: Win on Danger 5 with 0 items. At first this doesn't sound that bad, but each character I attempted this with struggled at different points - mostly against some of the later waves, the Elite or the final boss fight, but for different reasons. Loud for example can build up a lot of Attack Speed, but most runs ended rather early since it becomes insanely difficult to survive the enemies without healing from material or buying armor and melee damage items. Another problem with these challenges is that I may have the best character but due to a few unlucky runs I stop playing them. Today I went for Vagabond for the first time after getting too frustrated that I always had a few good stats but others were completely lacking, ending in a loss - and Vagabond let's all weapons count as every class so you get max bonuses from each weapon class equipped. While this does compensate for a lack of general stats, it relies a ton on what weapons you find and what level up stats you get to round up your build.

lxiOYVKh9_Q.title: I ONE SHOT the BOSSES (33,206 HP Wave 20) in Brotato
lxiOYVKh9_Q.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Loud with one simple but yet very complicated goal: One shot the Bosses at Wave 20. Reaching high damage numbers in Brotato is not hard to achieve if you go for Endless Mode, but the moment you get limited to just 20 waves you have way less options - and need way better RNG - to reach enough damage to one shot the bosses. How much? 33,206 Damage. So what's the plan? The rough plan is to get Obliterator as it's 1500% Ranged Damage scaling is the most absurd damage scaling on any weapon in the game, Cursed this can be up to 3150%. With a Crit that deals x2.3 damage, that goes up to 7245% Damage scaling, all of which lowers the Ranged Damage and %Damage requirement. So the plan is simple, but finding what you may as well call Exodia is what makes this so hard. Even if you find all the damage pieces, without enough economy you won't be able to get enough Ranged and %Damage, so a lot has to work out right.

oS3eVrxtidY.title: Crazy Attack Speed Immortal Thief Build in Endless Mode | Conquest Dark
oS3eVrxtidY.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vRXmxQDA3jw&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7BJ7feu_e5KRasCxxdHvxYc
Today we play more Conquest Dark and after a bit of a jump into the future now have access to the Thief, among...all other characters and most unlocks. Yea I played quite a bit on my own and we do this here to farm up resources. But today I want to go for an endless run in the arena of Conquest Dark and attempt a theory I had for an immortal build. It relies on dodges - not dashes, those are a separate thing - as dodges avoid a normal hit on you. I say normal because I know of 2 exceptions, but we won't encounter these. Now that sounds fine and good, but we'd run out of dodge charges right? Wrong, that's where we use the Artifact Edge of Darkness, which has a 10% chance (affected by proc chance bonuses) to refill ALL of your dodge charges hit a single hit. So I want to focus on multi-attacks and attack speed on our primary weapon as much as possible that we can be as safe as possible.

vc4YG7OlfmU.title: I BROKE Dungeon Clawler with INFINITY NaN
vc4YG7OlfmU.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7B0NqrHUe0yO1Hhx3qckULU
Today in Dungeon Clawler we play as the new character Astrobun again - but this time not to mess around, but to break the game. Not...just reaching a high number, but literally making it impossible to continue and being forced to quit out of the game. How? I'd say it's best to watch the video, I tried to cut it short that everything is rather quickly revelead, but as a small tip: Multiplicative multipliers is the keyword. Additive multipliers are something like crit damage, where you deal x2 damage, if you increase that you can deal x3, x4, x5, the point is the actual multiplicative damage is being added on top of. But multiplicative multipliers go from x2 to x4 to x8 to x16 and so on. So if you find a way to trigger these often enough, it gets ridiculous VERY fast.

Today in Megabonk I try to win without moving once. Now I define a win as getting to 0 minutes since this then spawns the endless waves, meaning you made it through the game and are now on a timer to die. That said, if you think a win would be a boss kill, I totally understand that - and the main reason I didn't even mention that in the video is that I simply haven't thought about it, since you can do the boss kill at any point or even never, but hitting 0 is always guaranteed to happen. So for me the boss is rather an additional thing. To say this challenge was tough would be an understatement and when you see the winning run you'll understand what was needed to get there. Pretty much 3 things had to work out, 2 of those just at the right moment.

OnL9gjgjJbg.title: I created the PERFECT Harvesting God in Brotato
OnL9gjgjJbg.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Farmer, Entrepreneur and Baby at the same time to create a Harvesting God. Farmer gains Harvesting per consumable picked up at full HP and also increases the end of round Harvesting bonus from 5% to 8%. Entrepreneur may not initially strike one as a part of the trio, but he reduces prices by 25% to buy more and scale faster while also increasing Harvesting bonuses by 50%! Yes, that's a huge chunk. And Baby reduces prices by another 20%, so we can buy even more, while also providing us with a total of 24 weapon slots, meaning 24 cursed gardens that at the same time increase in damage the more Harvesting we have. One Brotato I banished was Druid, just because Druid on his own is already insanely broken and the run would rather deviate away from being about Harvesting into being about just fruits, as you have a chance to gain Luck per fruit picked up. Which is crazy, don't get me wrong, but not really the goal of this.

✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyApNptjgdQ&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DZZtIfKIK6JrfOMwlIO1TB
Today we continue with Megabonk and what originally started as a "try out" video I do on my own - and lately started uploading on my second channel - quickly turned into a run where everything just worked out. Now if you ask me "Dex, do you think the Fox is the best now?" I would 100% say: No, we got carried hard by having the damage multipliers and it would have been so much better if we had 100% Crit Chance, instead of the low amount we had. That said though, I think it's still incredible that the character you start with and is arguably the worst out of all is right now the one that holds my highscore - and got me into the top 200.

✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyApNptjgdQ&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DZZtIfKIK6JrfOMwlIO1TB
Today we continue with Mega Bonk and try out Calcium - a Skeleton Buddy that starts out with Bone and gains movement speed periodically when not hit, though that may have a cap. And notably, if you block or dodge an attack, it does not count as a hit. While it started off relatively calm, even the first fun run got the furthest I've ever been. So in the second run I decided to go the build we figured out in the last run including XP, Difficulty and Luck Tome. Little did I know this would be the most broken run I've ever had and it's not even close, taking me into the top 250 worldwide.

WH7rzv7hcos.title: I turned into SUPERMAN in Megabonk
WH7rzv7hcos.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyApNptjgdQ&list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DZZtIfKIK6JrfOMwlIO1TB
Today we continue with Mega Bonk after we Clank - or Cl4nk - and want to test him out. Cl4nk gets 1% Crit Chance per level up and starts with the Revolver, which is a very fun weapon that relies on projectiles and bounces. After an amazing first run that sent us flying I realize I never got the unlocks for the Luck, Difficulty (Curse) and XP Tomes, so I ended up going for a second run that turned out to be absurdely lucky. Now overall, I definitely need to balance damage and economy upgrades better, but I really feel like the Pistol is sadly just not good. Similar to other projectile weapons it can't attack fast enough to deal with the insane enemies in the lategame that are so fast they borderline break sound barriers. But I definitely think I am on track to get a decent kill record going.

N3w1ERVmftE.title: The New GOD of Brotato
N3w1ERVmftE.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we settle once and for all why Druid has overtaken the old God, Demon. Demon is still very strong, but falls short scaling wise the further you go. Druid on the other hand can increase his damage so ridiculously high with multiplicatively scaling - he makes use of the items that scale with the constantly increasing Luck, so their base damage goes up, but then also converts Luck into %Damage. In our case we went crazy and hit 52% Damage per 10 Luck, or in other words 52 Pearls worth of Cursed Pearls.

5mzWkYOpFCE.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we do something quite different - we combine a fun idea together with the goal of becoming broken, by stacking as many Baby with a Beard as we can. This doesn't sound like a very broken thing, but for every Baby a dying enemy will shoot out 1 Bullet - so if you have 10 of them, it's 10 bullets. If then 5 enemies die from that, it's 50 bullets. You can see how that escalates quickly. Oh, and this run was pretty much an insane god run.

ttZiuRjp0w8.title: 2 Legendary Yorick Broke My Record in Balatro
ttZiuRjp0w8.description:
Today we are back with some more Balatro - this time it's a bit different though, since I didn't intent to even record. Initially the run was just a random fun run where I got 4 retrigger on the first card played, so e.g. a +3 Gold card now gets triggered 5 times, giving 15 Gold instead.  But I didn't realize yet that the main trickster is on it's way: Yorick. Not just 1, but 2. Yorick multiplies the multiplier, which increases by 1 every 23 discards - meaning now every 23 discards we increase it twice by 1. And since they multiply each other as well, it's a lot crazier.

EQ3tLIZmBf8.title: I Exploited Bounty of One for MOST BROKEN RUN Youve Ever Seen
EQ3tLIZmBf8.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7CMXM4UjhBUKfNkwfVLd4eD
Today we play Bounty of One again and as it's probably the last episode of this short re-visit to the game, I wanted to make sure we go out with a bang. Thanks to you guys we figured out 2 crucial elements of the game, for starters as long as nothing is chosen in the starter sheriff chest, I can just alt+F4 to start a new run that still has the chest - usually you have to beat the first Sheriff and quit out to get it. This makes resetting for the right starting object WAY faster. Second, and more importantly, one of you has figured out that rolling and then banishing all choices does not just banish the current choices, but also the ones we rolled over. So if the stars align and we (finally, because this took several tries) get just the right rolls to banish the things we don't want, we are just left with insane mythical upgrades.

0hF3nfC6lKQ.title: I hit E-VALUES in Bounty of One?! (Over 100M Damage)
0hF3nfC6lKQ.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7CMXM4UjhBUKfNkwfVLd4eD
Today we play Bounty of One again - after Real Civil Engineer reminded me of this gem, so thank you for that - but with the goal of reaching completely absurd damage numbers. No, I don't mean damage to one shot a boss, I don't mean 100,000 or even 1,000,000, I want to go above and beyond to hit numbers you may not have even known existed in this game - the E-values. E just refers to how many spots you have to move over the comma, so a 1E+07 is the same as 10,000,000, while 1E+08 is then 100,000,000 or 100 Million.

zezkXakRZMM.title: This hidden OP Stratgey is actually BROKEN! | Brotato Abyssal Terrors
zezkXakRZMM.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Romantic and this time with a new OP strategy I thought of a while ago but couldn't quite get to work. Now each strategy or build has its own strengths and weaknesses, but it mostly depends what they are for - in this case, it's for Endless only, mostly since it's a bit difficult to get everything in time. Don't get me wrong, you can still beat Danger 5 Classic Brotato with it as shown here, but it's way harder than some other strategies. So what do we do? We spam turrets. Romantic has a chance to charm enemies with each hit he lands once they reach 25% HP - this also includes the damage turrets deal. So the plan is to get a ton of turrets with a ton of attack speed, proc Giant's Belt like stupid and then charm them to finish them off. That last part sounds a bit sus.

z584G5GwJPU.title: I found the ULTIMATE Legendary Upgrade in Everwarder
z584G5GwJPU.description:
✵Game on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/2307170/Everwarder/
Today we check out Everwarder, a very fun game that is best described by taking Dome Keeper, minimizing mining and maximizing tower defense. You spawn in a randomly generated area and have to place down Crystals to mine out the surrounding area. Whenever a block is mined, an enemy spawns and wants to attack your Crystal, which is your base you have to protect. Enemies have 3 different types, indicated by their spawn area, and the game follows a simple rock-paper-scissor-principle, where a tower can deal 2x, 1x or 0.5x damage based on it's own and the enemy type. As we dig through the enemy blocks we also discover artifact fragments, once 5 are collected we get to choose an artifact. These will give the tower it's meant for a special effect, while the others receive an increase to their Gem amount - and Gems are what determine how strong an upgrade is for that tower. So eventually you have to decide if you want to give your main tower a special effect, or if you want to instead get one for another tower but it will give more gems to the main tower, which then upgrades all the other upgrades you have unlocked for it.

Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Renegade, a character that gains +2 Projectiles on his weapons at the cost of losing 80% Damage scaling - and starting with -80% Damage. F7PMNjmQj_A.title: The secret Pacifist God Mode technique | Brotato Abyssal Terrors Modded
F7PMNjmQj_A.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7COFhHaKCiYIbqEaN0F9uh9
Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors combine the Pacifist, the Explorer and the Cryptid into 1 character - meaning we spawn a ton of trees, gain bonus material out of that and don't want to kill enemies to get more material from the Pacifist. Not that we could though since we only deal 1 damage and with our insanely negative %Damage, there is also no fast way to change that. While playing I got quite surprised how the run felt quite good, like a normal character would. It's pretty much just a Pacifist run but removes a lot of frustration and replaces it with fun. The map is bigger and a minigame is added to avoid all trees. Once enough spawned, the additional healing from Cryptid (3 HP Regeneration per Tree) keeps us alive. But there is a tipping point - the Giants Belt. This must be one of the most hilarious things I personally experienced in Brotato, seeing our weapon deal a miniscule amount of damage but slapping the enemies out of existence due to the Giants Belt effect.

Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as the Baby and go for what should be the perfect weapon - the Captain Sword. Baby can have up to 24 weapon slots and the Captain Swords gains 25 (or 50 upgraded) bonus damage per empty weapon slot. So it should be the perfect weapon for the Baby, right? Just instantly becoming an insane nuke? Technically yes, but the main issue is the rarity of the weapon - and on top of that the Baby is one of the worst characters in the game according to my own subjective feeling. Without stat level ups, you lack so many stats that you build up over time that it's hard to make anything work that's not completely broken (like Sticks).

Today on the DLC for Brotato Abyssal Terrors we play as Old - not just once, but 3 times. Meaning instead of just losing 33% Map Size, it's 3x33%. I'm not sure what the exact result for the map size is, either the game limits it or it's 1x0.67x0.67x0.67=30%, which sounds more reasonable (I made a math error in the video, when I said 13/14% I accidentally reduced it by 67% once, not 33%). As you can imagine, with such a tiny map the game becomes quite different - but more in an interesting way. Melee weapons become a lot more useful, but you will always have the enemies right in your face - and the -30% Speed loss from 3 times Old should also not be underestimated.

7cB6d5nHWps.title: I completely Broke Vampire Survivors - it Disabled the Game
7cB6d5nHWps.description:
✵Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEnz2EwvYH7DuJpa1e8YUnaPTSoHyVI7S
Today in the Vampire Survivors DLC Ode to Castlevania we play as Lisa Tepes and limit break the evolution of Luminatio called Vol Luminatio. The weapon scales off of Growth, which increases it's Damage, Speed, Area and Duration - and since Lisa gains 1% Growth every level up that's a nice synergy. Now while the goal of these videos is to break the weapons, it's not really to actually break the game, but today we encounter a - confirmed - issue that our stats got so high and the weapon so broken, that it apparently infinitely continues to spiral around us, freezing the game completely.

VS Mod used: https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/87?tab=description
